column4: is it possible to install grub in DVD and make it boot some .iso files burned on the DVD???
Why would you want it to boot iso files?
im tryin to make a dvd with several distros
Ahh, there is a better way to do that
how ?

http://www.linux.com/articles/52927 And for future reference it is usually good to state your end goal before you ask a question like that, because you may have many people that can help you but never get an answer to the question you ask :)
if u find any solution in that page for what im trying to do, Ill give u a million dollars
none of that works man
Maybe I misunderstand what you are trying to do then, because that is an article about how to "make a custom DVD to boot multiple live CDs" unless I gave you the wrong link
i refers to a script that doesnt exist in the hole internet
Ahh, that does pose a problem doesn't it :)
u have any idea how to do it? have u ever did something like this?
You could try the script linked to in the comments of that page, though I don't know how respectable it is
doesnt exist anymore
http://mikukkon.googlepages.com/make_dvd_05.tgz works here
Where's my million dollars ? ;)
it has to work... probable wont because i want to burn different distros than that script lets u
doesnt work it only works for some distros.... hehe told u
Damn, and here I thought I was going to get rich :)
For what distros that you need does it not work?
i want to make a dvd with the ubuntu mandriva fedora gparted
I would expect Ubuntu mandrivia and gparted to be layed out basically the same way ( BTW, mandrivia Ubuntu and fedora all contain gparted on their liveCD's so gparted is somewhat redundant )
